practiceQuestions.prompt: What is the maximum number of #12 AWG THHN conductors allowed in a 1/2-inch EMT conduit according to the NEC?
practiceQuestions.explanation: According to NEC Annex C, Table C.1, the maximum number of #12 AWG THHN conductors in 1/2-inch EMT is 9.

practiceQuestions.prompt: In California, what is the maximum height for a wall-mounted light switch in a residential unit to comply with Title 24 accessibility requirements?
practiceQuestions.explanation: To meet accessibility standards, switches should generally not exceed 48 inches above the floor.

practiceQuestions.prompt: Which type of GFCI protection is required for outdoor 15A and 20A receptacles?

choices.text: No GFCI required if they are weather-resistant

practiceQuestions.explanation: Class A GFCIs are designed to trip when a ground fault exceeds 6mA, which is the standard for personnel protection.

practiceQuestions.prompt: What is the minimum working clearance depth required in front of a 120/240V electrical panel?
practiceQuestions.explanation: NEC 110.26 requires a minimum depth of 3 feet (36 inches) for voltages to ground of 0-150V.

practiceQuestions.prompt: When installing a 100A subpanel, what is the minimum size copper THWN conductor required for the feeders?
practiceQuestions.explanation: Using the 75°C column of Table 310.16, #3 AWG copper is rated for 100A.

practiceQuestions.prompt: What color must the high-leg (wild leg) of a 4-wire delta-connected system be identified with?
practiceQuestions.explanation: NEC 110.15 requires the high-leg of a 4-wire delta system to be identified by the color orange.

practiceQuestions.prompt: How many 125V, 20A branch circuits are required for a dwelling unit's small appliance loads?
practiceQuestions.explanation: NEC 210.11(C)(1) requires at least two small appliance branch circuits for kitchens, dining areas, and pantries.

practiceQuestions.prompt: What is the maximum distance between supports for 3/4-inch RMC (Rigid Metal Conduit)?
practiceQuestions.explanation: NEC 344.30(A) generally requires RMC to be supported at intervals not exceeding 10 feet.

practiceQuestions.prompt: Which of the following is an acceptable method for grounding a service?

choices.text: Connecting to a metal underground gas pipe
Connecting to a 10-foot metal underground water pipe
Connecting to a plastic septic tank
Connecting to a wooden fence post

practiceQuestions.explanation: A metal underground water pipe in direct contact with the earth for 10 feet or more is a required grounding electrode.

practiceQuestions.prompt: What is the multiplier for calculating the minimum volume of a 4-inch square box for a #12 AWG conductor?
practiceQuestions.explanation: Table 314.16(B) lists the volume allowance for #12 AWG as 2.25 cubic inches.

examQuestions.prompt: A 15HP 230V 3-phase motor has a full-load current of 42A. What is the minimum ampacity required for the branch-circuit conductors?
examQuestions.explanation: Branch-circuit conductors for a single motor must have an ampacity of at least 125% of the motor's FLC. 42A * 1.25 = 52.5A.

examQuestions.prompt: What is the maximum percentage of fill allowed for a conduit with more than two conductors?
examQuestions.explanation: NEC Chapter 9, Table 1 specifies 40% fill for three or more conductors.

examQuestions.prompt: A dwelling unit has a total calculated load of 45,000 VA. For a 120/240V single-phase service, what is the minimum service size?
examQuestions.explanation: 45,000 VA / 240V = 187.5A. The next standard service size is 200A.

examQuestions.prompt: What is the maximum distance from a floor to the top of a receptacle in a residential living room to count towards the wall space requirements?
examQuestions.explanation: Receptacles must be installed so that no point along the floor line in any wall space is more than 6 feet from a receptacle. Usually they are within 18 inches of the floor.

examQuestions.prompt: Which of the following locations requires AFCI protection in a new residence?
examQuestions.explanation: NEC 210.12 requires AFCI protection for all 120V, 15A and 20A branch circuits supplying outlets in family rooms, dining rooms, living rooms, parlors, libraries, dens, bedrooms, etc.

examQuestions.prompt: What is the minimum size grounding electrode conductor for a 200A service with 2/0 AWG copper service-entrance conductors?
examQuestions.explanation: NEC Table 250.66 requires a #4 AWG copper GEC for 2/0 AWG copper service conductors.

examQuestions.prompt: How many degrees of total bends are allowed between pull points in a run of conduit?
examQuestions.explanation: NEC 358.26 (for EMT) and similar sections for other conduits limit the total number of bends to 360 degrees between pull points.

examQuestions.prompt: Which type of conduit is specifically approved for direct burial without concrete encasement?
examQuestions.explanation: Schedule 40 PVC is rated for direct burial.

examQuestions.prompt: What is the minimum burial depth for Rigid Metal Conduit (RMC) under a residential driveway?
examQuestions.explanation: Table 300.5 requires a minimum of 18 inches for any conduit type under a residential driveway.

examQuestions.prompt: In a 3-phase, 4-wire Wye system, what is the voltage between any phase and the neutral if the phase-to-phase voltage is 480V?
What is the demand factor for the first 3,000 VA of a general lighting load for a dwelling unit?
examQuestions.explanation: Table 220.42 specifies 100% for the first 3,000 VA of residential lighting load.

examQuestions.prompt: Which of the following is NOT a required grounding electrode if present at the building?
examQuestions.explanation: NEC 250.52(B)(1) prohibits using a metal underground gas piping system as a grounding electrode.

examQuestions.prompt: What is the maximum setting for a motor branch-circuit short-circuit and ground-fault protective device (Inverse Time Breaker) for a 3-phase squirrel-cage motor?
examQuestions.explanation: Table 430.52 specifies 250% for inverse time breakers for most motors.

examQuestions.prompt: A continuous load is one where the maximum current is expected to continue for how many hours or more?
examQuestions.explanation: NEC Article 100 defines a continuous load as one expected to continue for 3 hours or more.

examQuestions.prompt: What is the required clear working space width in front of electrical equipment?
examQuestions.explanation: NEC 110.26(A)(2) requires the width of the working space to be the width of the equipment or 30 inches, whichever is greater.

cards.front: What is Ohm's Law formula for Voltage?
What is the standard residential voltage for lighting and receptacles?
What color is the neutral wire in a standard 120V circuit?
What is the purpose of a circuit breaker?
cards.back: To protect the circuit from overcurrent and short circuits.

cards.front: What is the unit of measure for electrical power?

cards.back: An enclosure where electrical connections are made.
The maximum, instantaneous input current drawn by an electrical device when first turned on.

cards.front: What is the purpose of bonding?
cards.back: To ensure electrical continuity and the capacity to safely conduct any fault current.
A secondary electrical panel that receives its power from the main service panel.
A metallic bar that conducts electricity within a switchboard or panelboard.

cards.front: What is the maximum number of degrees of bend allowed in a conduit run?
What is the standard frequency of AC power in the US?

cards.back: The point where the utility company's wires connect to the building's wiring system.

cards.front: What is the purpose of a ground rod?
cards.back: To provide a direct path to earth for lightning strikes or surges.
